definition: to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

sentences.english: Chinais incapable of, and does not wish to protect itself from nuclear blackmail.
sentences.chinese: 中國無力，同時也不希望保護自己免受核訛詐。

sentences.english: That woman is wanted in 5 states for credit-card fraud.
sentences.chinese: 那位婦女因信譽卡訛詐而被5個州通緝。

sentences.english: Their policy of nuclear blackmail has fallen through.
sentences.chinese: 他們的核訛詐政策破產了。

sentences.english: America and the world will not be blackmailed . Applause.
sentences.chinese: 美國和整個世界是不會接受這種訛詐的。

sentences.english: The Chinese government has from the beginning opposed nuclear blackmail and the nuclear deterrent policy.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府歷來反對核訛詐和核威懾政策。

sentences.english: And finally, the Madoff scandal continues to provoke extreme horror.
sentences.chinese: 最後，馬多夫訛詐案陰霾未散，恐懼的氣氛依然存在。

sentences.english: I don't believe the policy of power politics can blackmail us into submission.
sentences.chinese: 我們不信實力政策能夠訛詐我們屈服。

sentences.english: The thieves bride-kidnapping sunflower blackmail to tokugawa, but get away but met are dragon.
sentences.chinese: 小偷們欲擄走葵花訛詐德川，但逃走時卻遇上正龍。

sentences.english: He extorted money from poor farmers under false pretences.
sentences.chinese: 他訛詐窮苦農民的錢財。

sentences.english: I feel like I've been gypped.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我好像被訛詐了。

sentences.english: I'm never prepared to surrender to blackmail.
sentences.chinese: 我根本不準備向訛詐屈服。

sentences.english: The strange man tried to blackmail the clerk into helping him draw the money, but he failed.
sentences.chinese: 陌生人想訛詐職員迫使他幫他取出錢，但未能得逞。

sentences.english: The foreign minister declared in a statement to the press that he would never submit to blackmail.
sentences.chinese: 外長在向新聞界發表的聲明中宣稱他決不屈服於訛詐。

sentences.english: He in the name of the security bureau, a sinner, eight gold bar.
sentences.chinese: 他以保安局的名義，訛詐了八根金條。

definition: lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
